item.title: George Floyd death: Ex-officer charged with murder in Minneapolis
item.description: An ex-police officer in Minneapolis is detained over the death of unarmed black man George Floyd.

item.title: Coronavirus: What happens next?
item.description: Clive Myrie meets patients and staff on the Covid ward at the Royal London Hospital.

item.title: Coronavirus: Relaxing lockdown 'risky' and a 'political decision'
item.description: Warning from top scientist advising government says cases are still at very high levels.

item.title: Coronavirus furlough scheme to finish at end of October, says chancellor
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak says employers must start sharing the cost of the scheme from August.

item.title: Virus-hit self-employed to receive second payment
item.description: Applications for a "second and final" grant of up to £6,570 will open in August, the chancellor says.

item.title: Coronavirus: Trump terminates US relationship with WHO
item.description: The president accuses the UN health agency of "failing" over its handling of the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus: GPs not told when patients removed from 'shielding lists'
item.description: This has caused confusion and anxiety among extremely vulnerable people staying at home.

item.title: Coronavirus: Renters struggle most with pandemic costs, report says
item.description: Private renters are struggling with housing costs more than mortgage-payers, new research suggests.

item.title: Coronavirus: Greece to open up in two weeks, but not to the UK
item.description: Tourists from 29 countries will be able to visit Greece from 15 June, but not travellers from the UK.

item.title: Trump targets China over Hong Kong security law
item.description: Donald Trump says he will end Hong Kong's special status with the US over China's new security law.

item.title: SpaceX launch: Nasa astronauts set for second try
item.description: SpaceX will need to beat the weather to get Nasa astronauts Doug Hurley and Bob Behnken into orbit.

item.title: Kylie Jenner: Forbes drops celebrity from billionaire list
item.description: The magazine says the Kardashian family misled the press about the value of Jenner's makeup business.

item.title: The Papers: Weekend lockdown warnings and 'border farce'
item.description: Concerns over the public sticking to rules ahead of restrictions being lifted dominate Saturday's papers.

item.title: Week in pictures: 23-29 May 2020
item.description: A selection of news photographs taken around the world this week.

item.title: Coronavirus: Debenhams makes some restaurant employees redundant
item.description: Retailer Debenhams makes staff in some of its cafes redundant after going into administration.

item.title: Coronavirus: Belgian zoo comes back to life from lockdown
item.description: After two months without visitors, Pairi Daiza is welcoming the public back, but in smaller numbers.

item.title: Remi Wolf on how she makes music videos in lockdown
item.description: How rising star Remi Wolf made the promotional video for her new track in the middle of the pandemic.

item.title: DIY dentistry: What is safe to do to your own teeth?
item.description: How can you treat your own teeth while waiting to see a dentist?

item.title: Quiz of the Week: Why was Neighbours back in the news?
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: PlayStation 5: Sony confident coronavirus won't change release plans
item.description: The CEO of PlayStation reveals how it's responded to coronavirus as it prepares to release the PS5.

item.title: Robbie Williams to rejoin Take That for virtual gig
item.description: The old band are (almost all) back together for a charity event, broadcast from each of their homes.

item.title: The coronavirus 'class divide': Parents shamed for back-to-school choices
item.description: Parents of year six and year one pupils have been falling out over whether to send them back to school.

item.title: Coronavirus: When will public toilets be reopened?
item.description: The lack of public loos has led to reports of visitors defecating in public spaces.

item.title: Uzma Khan: An actress assaulted, a jealous wife and a viral video in Pakistan
item.description: Uzma Khan was beaten by three rich women and their guards. Why is this not a headline in Pakistan?

item.title: How do you get a British National (Overseas) passport?
item.description: The UK waded into the Hong Kong security row by proposing more rights for holders of a special passport.

item.title: Rohingya refugee crisis: 'The bodies were thrown out of the boat'
item.description: Khadiza Begum, a Rohingya refugee, left Myanmar to escape violence but found more horror at sea.

item.title: Coronavirus: What to expect when hairdressers reopen
item.description: Prepare for a quick in and out with masks, screens and hand gel - don't expect magazines or coffee.

item.title: The coronavirus conundrum when your mouth is your ‘hand’
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic becomes a different kind of challenge when you use your mouth as your ‘hands’.

item.title: Coronavirus: Who are the contact tracers and what are they doing?
item.description: Doctors, call centre staff and students are some of the 25,000 people chasing Covid-19 cases in England.

item.title: Film festival hopes to 'inspire' amid pandemic
item.description: Cannes, Toronto and Sundance are among the film festivals uniting for an online streaming event.

item.title: 'I could hardly walk' - Leicester boss Rodgers reveals he had coronavirus
item.description: Leicester City manager Brendan Rodgers says he "had no strength" after contracting the coronavirus in March.

item.title: Federer becomes world's highest paid athlete
item.description: Swiss tennis player Roger Federer overtakes footballer Lionel Messi as the world's highest paid athlete for 2020, according to Forbes.

item.title: Premier League: Liverpool could seal title at neutral venue with six fixtures set to move
item.description: The game in which Liverpool could secure the Premier League title could be held at a neutral venue, says the national lead for football policing.

item.title: Chisora wants MMA bout during Usyk delay
item.description: British boxer Dereck Chisora says he might compete in mixed martial arts while he waits to fight Oleksandr Usyk.

item.title: Coronavirus substitutes may be allowed in England Tests
item.description: Coronavirus replacements could be allowed in England's summer Test series with West Indies and Pakistan.

item.title: Bayern make offer for Man City's Sane - Saturday's football gossip
item.description: Bayern Munich offer Manchester City Lucas Hernandez in swap deal for Leroy Sane, Ac Milan target Burnley's Jeff Hendrick, plus more.

item.title: Williams F1 team up for sale after £13m loss
item.description: The Williams Formula 1 team and wider company group are up for sale after posting a £13m loss last year.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Guidelines to social contact are starting to change across the UK.

item.title: Coronavirus: What does it mean if I've been furloughed by work?
item.description: Millions unable to do their job due to coronavirus will have their wages paid by a new scheme.

item.title: Coronavirus: What help are self-employed getting from government?
item.description: What is being done for the five million self-employed people in the UK facing a sudden loss of income?

item.title: Will I still get paid if I have to self-isolate? And other questions
item.description: Will employees still get paid if they are told to self-isolate? And other questions answered by BBC experts.

item.title: Coronavirus: We answer kids' questions about going back to school
item.description: The BBC's Education Editor Branwen Jeffreys answers kids' questions about going back to school.

item.title: Coronavirus: Dental practices to reopen from 8 June
item.description: Dental practices in England have been told they can reopen from Monday, 8 June.

item.title: Lockdown update: All you need to know about new measures
item.description: How will social and work life be different after the easing of some restrictions around the UK?

item.title: Dominic Cummings: Fact-checking the row
item.description: Senior Conservatives are still questioning adviser's account of driving his family 260 miles during lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: How will contact tracing work in England?
item.description: Millions in the UK will soon be asked to monitor who they have been near to combat coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: What can you do in Scotland from Friday?
item.description: After almost 10 weeks of lockdown which restrictions are being eased - and which remain in force?

item.title: Dominic Cummings: Did he break lockdown rules?
item.description: The UK PM's most senior adviser has responded to accusations that he broke lockdown rules - what did he say?

item.title: Coronavirus: What tests are being done in the UK?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus: Which schools are reopening for pupils?
item.description: Which children will be the first to go back to school, and what about the rest?

item.title: Coronavirus: When will shops open and what will the rules be?
item.description: Non-essential shops can reopen in England next month, but will I be able to buy a book or have a haircut?

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: How to keep safe while shopping in a coronavirus pandemic
item.description: From one way systems to not touching everything on the shelves - shopping will look very different.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can it affect eyesight?
item.description: The prime minister's chief adviser says his vision was affected by coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the rules on caring for children during lockdown?
item.description: A look at the guidance as Downing Street backs Dominic Cummings over his 260-mile lockdown trip.

item.title: Dominic Cummings row: The families who stayed away in lockdown
item.description: Members of the public have expressed anger after the PM's chief adviser travelled to Durham in lockdown.

item.title: Amazon under threat: Fires, loggers and now virus
item.description: How the loss of the Amazon goes beyond deforestation - and what the nine countries that share this natural resource are doing to protect it.
